title: Good food with great views
text: Had lunch over at Skai Restaurant at Swissotel. Located at the 70th floor, the restaurant comes with a commanding view of the Singapore skyline. Food is excellent and a great place to entertain guests.

title: Great food and nice ambience
text: Went to Akira Back for a birthday dinner. Service was impeccable and food was excellent. A nice place to go for that special evening out.

title: Delicious paper wrap chicken!
text: The restaurant ambiance is nice and understated luxury. More importantly, it’s their food that is the star of the show. A must try is their paper wrapped chicken. Very delicious!

title: Excellent food and service!
text: Went there to celebrate my cousin’s birthday. The food and service did not disappoint. The crispy hor fun and the London duck was most memorable. Restaurant staff Jude who looked after us was most attentive as well. All in all a good restaurant and will return.

title: Great food and excellent service
text: Had the Sukiya Steamboat and we opted for the premium option which has a free flow of wagyu beef. It was worth the money as the beef was very tasty. The manager at the branch Eddie was very friendly and welcoming and we enjoyed our visit to the restaurant. Thanks Eddie for the wonderful evening

title: Gem of a place! Your private hideaway in Fira!
text: The hotel is a cave hotel and very exclusive. It has cave rooms and each level comes with a pool. The property overlooks the sea and you get very nice views of the caldera. It is also close the the city centre. Antonio was friendly and helpful and made our stay a very memorable one. Thank you Antonio!

title: Amazing views from the city walls
text: A walk around the city walls around Dubrovnik old town is a must. The walls take you around the old city and rewards those who walk the walls with spectacular views of the Adriatic Sea.

title: Great food and great view!
text: Went up to panorama restaurant to catch the view of Dubrovnik old town. It did not disappoint. The view was breathtaking and the food was delicious which was a bonus. Restaurant staff was also friendly and patient as we were not familiar with which Croatian wines to order.

title: Breathtakingly Beautiful!
text: Dubrovnik old town is breathtakingly beautiful. It’s entire city wall is intact and you can do a walk around the wall. You would also love the walk along the streets and just marvel this gem of the ancient city. You would just fall in love with this city. Tip: try to catch the sunset from one of the high vantage point. It’s beautiful.

title: Amazing Lounge!
text: Transited in Istanbul and visited the Turkish Airlines Star Alliance Gold Lounge. The lounge was simply amazing. It was huge and spacious and comes with live cooking stations. The drinks were well stocked and they had a mini “hotel” within the lounge where they provide bedrooms for their business class passengers. Turkish Airlines have certainly up the game in terms of lounge facilities for star alliance gold card members!

title: Great food and great ambiance!
text: The restaurant is located in the museum gardens and serves great food in a very nice and warm setting. Food and service was excellent. Highly recommended for that special outing with family or friends.

title: Great view of the Haga Sophia!
text: Was in Istanbul and was recommended seven hills cafe and restaurant at sultanahmet. The restaurant provides a great view of the blue mosque and the haga sophia from their rooftop. Their fish dish was equally delicious as well. Well worth a visit if you are in Istanbul. The view from their rooftop is itself worth a visit!

title: Resort hotel in Dubrovnik
text: The hotel is located at the western side of Dubrovnik near when the yacht club and cruise ships park. The hotel seems to be popular with tour groups and rooms are basic but comfortable. There is a big buffet restaurant where they serve breakfast and dinner. Dubrovnik is about a 10 mins taxi ride away.

title: Nice hotel in Dubrovnik
text: Stayed at the Sheraton for 3 nights. The hotel is situated about 15 mins drive away from the hustle and bustle of Dubrovnik old town. The Hotel is nice, clean and modern. Request for a sea facing room. The views are beautiful.

title: Nice Boutique hotel in the centre of Athens
text: Stayed at the Academia for 3 nights. It’s a lovely hotel near the university and a short walk to syntagma square. Hotel felt new, beds comfortable and pillows and towels plush. The hotel was first class and you could tell it was very good quality. Only complaint was in winter, they switched off the air con which can make the room warm and stuffy if you are like me who likes the room to be cool. Perhaps the hotel could consider keeping the air con on for one floor for guest who prefer cool rooms. Otherwise, a quality luxury hotel.

title: Nice hotel with convenient access to terminal 2
text: The Hilton garden inn at Heathrow is very convenient and provides direct access to terminal 2 via the car park. Rooms are big and clean and the room has stayed in came with great views of the terminal and runways. Great for plane spotters and for people who have an early flight to catch.
place: Hilton Garden Inn London Heathrow Terminals 2 and 3

title: Lovely and Charming Christmas market in York!
text: The Christmas market in York has a wide selection of little kiosk/stalls that sell a wide variety of items ranging from cheese to fudge to the more touristy souvenirs. They have a good selection of hot food items on hand to fill the hungry stomach when doing your shopping!

title: Nice food but a bit pricey
text: The restaurant is located in a neighborhood up on the slopes of Athens. It can be a bit difficult to find. Menus are in Greek only and you would need the waiter to translate for you. The beef and the lamb are great and so is the fillet of sea bass.

title: Awesome landmark with matching awesome view.
text: What can I say. The Acropolis is world famous and a must visit landmark when in Athens. The top of the Acropolis comes with equally breathtaking sweeping views of Athens. A visit that one will not regret.

title: Excellent food in centre of Athens
text: The Ella restaurant serves up excellent traditional Greek food. The food was delicious and the waiting staff were friendly and professional. They carry their own Ella house wines as well. Worth a try.

title: A must visit when in York!
text: If you are ever in York, a visit to Bettys for tea is a must do. Service is attentive without being intrusive and the ambience is just wonderful. One can just sit and watch the world go by!

title: Great and hearty breakfast!
text: Stayed at the doubletree Manchester. They serve a great and hearty breakfast in their restaurant store street exchange. Food selection was varied and quality of food was excellent. A perfect way to start the day!

title: Great roast meat in York!
text: Tried the York Roast at the stonegate branch. Food was great as usual and we had ordered the beef with the pudding. The restaurant is located at stonegate and they have seating on the upper floor which is great for people watching!

title: Excellent property with fantastic staff!
text: The property is located within a 5 mins walk from Manchester Piccadilly train station. Hotel building and the rooms are clean and new. The rooms are of good size and the one I stayed in cane with a great view. Staff is fantastic and a special mention of check in staff Shannon who was cheery and helpful and made the whole stay experience a wonderful one. Well done and thank you Shannon!

title: Worst first class experience to York!
text: Took the trans-pennine express service from. Manchester Piccadilly to York on the 1557 service to redcar central. Paid for 3 first class tickets. The service was any but first class. It was standing room only. The first class cabin was chock a block and packed full like a sardine can. Not worth the first class ticket i paid and not what was advertised. Very disappointing service from transpennie express.

title: Nice food and great ambience
text: For any die hard fans of Hard Rock Cafe, a visit to the original HRC in London is a must. Food is excellent and generous in portion. Ambiance is great with the decor and memorabilia.

title: Nice hotel in central London
text: The Hyatt regency is located at Portman square and just 10 mins walk away from oxford street and marble arch tube station. Rooms are nice and standard size. Towels are fluffy and bed comfortable. One small thing that irritated me is the toilet flush which is hidden behind the lid. So each time you want to flush, you need to put down the lid. Otherwise, a delightful hotel in the heart of London.

title: Excellent Business class lounge
text: The Lufthansa Senator Lounge at Frankfurt sets the standard for airport lounges. It was quiet and spacious and served a wide array of food and drinks. It has very good shower facilities and even a pay per use spa! Very good lounge!

title: Excellent Economy Class product
text: Travelled on Aegean Airlines from Thessaloniki to Frankfurt. The economy class seat pitch was good and comfortable. It was a very comfortable flight.

title: Grand old Dame of Thessaloniki
text: Stayed here for a night. Hotel was located right in the heart of town at Aristotle square and facing the sea. The hotel commands a grand view of the square and the sea and a view of mount Olympus in the distant background. We had asked for a non smoking room but unfortunately, the guests from the next door room were smoking and the smoke drifted into our room. But otherwise we had nothing to complain about the hotel.

title: Great city views of Astana!
text: The tower provides visitors sweeping views of the city skyline of Astana. It also have a small cafe where you can take a rest to enjoy a coffee and ice cream. Worth a visit if you are in Astana.

title: The best hotel in Astana!
text: Stayed at the Ritz Carlton Astana. Was very impressed by the quality of their service as well as their rooms. We stayed in a deluxe room and it was very spacious. The beds were very comfortable and the toilets were very big. Bedside table had ample charging points. Took us a while to figure out how to use the electronic curtains which was a cool feature. You don’t need to get out of bed to open the curtains! The club lounge was excellent and the club lounge staff Maral was on hand to provide great service. Kudos to Tom Coveney and his excellent team of colleagues. All in all, a truly 5 star experience. Well done!

title: Excellent restaurant with great food and ambience
text: A lovely gem in the old town of Warsaw. The restaurant is located in a smart looking townhouse with a cozy ambience. Food and service was excellent. I had the duck breast and the consommé. It was a nice meal and an ideal place to take that someone special for a special meal.

title: Nice flight but could be better
text: Flight from Astana to Warsaw was on a 737-800. Business class seats were in the old cradle seat with no leg rest. While it was spacious for a 737-800, it was a tad uncomfortable for a 5 hour flight. Ideally, they should have lie flat seats with tv screens for inflight entertainment. For this 5 hour flight, there was none. Food was not bad and service good. They need to improve the hard product on their 737s.

title: Good effort by Lot Polish Airlines
text: Travelled on Lot’s latest 787-9 from Warsaw to Singapore. Lot’s business product is in a 2-2-2 configuration and although not in a 1-2-1 configuration, was still comfortable. The business class seat converts into a full flat bed and is comfortable. The seat however does not have a power socket although it comes with usb charging ports which was located in an odd position which makes charging your devices rather inconvenient. Meal wise, food was good and delicious and service could be a bit more personal. Otherwise, it was a comfortable ride back to Singapore.

title: Excellent food and 5 star Service!
text: We had a working dinner at Peach Garden restaurant which is located at the 33rd floor of OCBC building. We ordered ala carte from the menu. Food was superb as usual and the service attentive without being intrusive. Strongly recommend the wasabi prawn and kurobuta pork.

title: Great food and great view!
text: Found out about this restaurant on eatigo app. Service and food was good. The restaurant staff took the effort to ensure the Tom yum was not too spicy as one of my guest had some challenges with spicy food. Watermelon fried rice and the pad Thai was very delicious! Well done!

title: Nice kids friendly cafe to hang around
text: Visited this cafe to catch up with friends who has a young baby. Restaurant was nicely decorated and spacious with a large outdoor field in front of the cafe. Food was not bad but coffee was a bit strong. Diluted it with some milk. A nice place to hang out for a lazy weekend afternoon.

title: Excellent Gem of a restaurant
text: We celebrated a birthday in our family and visited the newly opened restaurant at Wheelock Place. The Chef Khaled and his wife Agnes were on hand to explain the new menus to us and were happy to see us back. Their dishes are simply excellent and cooked to the highest standard. We had the beef and the tomahawk and the kids had some pasta. All in all it was an awesome outing with great food and wonderful hospitality from Khaled and Agnes. Will surely come back again!

title: Delicious Crab Bee Hoon!
text: Was there to celebrate a birthday for a relative. The restaurant’s crab bee hoon was to die for. The crab was big and the gravy was yummy. They serve other Zi char items as well. Restaurant gets very crowded during the weekend so best to book ahead before you go.

title: Excellent food and great service!
text: Came here with family to enjoy the national day fireworks. We had an enjoyable meal and was well looked after by Maricel who was very attentive with prompt and polite service. It was a very memorable evening.

title: Nice restaurant but beware of their chairs!
text: Visited Hot stones at Clarke quay for a dinner with our friends. Food was not bad but the staff was a little overwhelmed with the crowd. So service and response to orders was a bit slow. But as we were there with friends for the evening and not in a hurry, it was ok. Choose tables with non rattan chairs as the ones we sat on had sharp edges which will scratch your skin or trousers/skirts

title: Great Airport for Tokyo!
text: Haneda is a much more pleasant airport to use when visiting Tokyo. It’s proximity and ease of getting into downtown Tokyo makes it a very attractive airport to use when compared to Narita airport which is much further away.
place: Tokyo International Airport (Haneda) Terminal No2 Observation Deck

title: Great Wang Kalbitang!
text: Visited Hanuso restaurant at Insadong-gil. The restaurant is located at orakai building. Ordered the Wang kalbitang. The beef ribs were tender and yummy and the soup was delicious! Price was 12500 won which included rice and side dishes such as kimchi and white noodles. Yummy.

title: Worth a visit!
text: The botanic gardens are located very close to the main shopping street of orchard road. Once in the gardens, you feel like a whole away from the hustle and bustle of city life. Definitely worth a visit!

title: New hotel in the heart of Seoul
text: Stayed at the Gracery Hotel for 2 nights. The hotel is conveniently located on the main road and just s short walk from the city hall subway lines 1 and 2. Rooms are clean and functional but a bit small. Hotel has a strict check out policy and you need to be out by 12 noon or else they start charging you 22000 won per hour if you extend a late checkout. Unlike other big chain hotels, they do not have complimentary late checkout. Hotel provides useful amenities such as toothbrushes and shaver.

title: Photo of flight from Gimpo to Haneda
text: Photos of flight from Gimpo to Haneda on ANA 787-8. Overall a good product with great inflight service and excellent food.

title: Great food and ambiance
text: Nice restaurant located at the shinshegae department shopping mall next to the express bus terminal. Great selection of food.

title: Excellent flight for a short haul sector
text: I flew on ANA from Gimpo to Tokyo Haneda. For this short sector of 2 hours, ANA deploy their 787-8 aircraft which although not as good as their 787-9 product, does the job just as well. Business cabin was in a 2-2-2 configuration as opposed to their better 1-2-1 product on their 787-9 aircraft. Food and service was excellent as usual. Considering this was a short flight of 2 hours, it does the job and was comfortable.

title: Excellent flight!
text: Travelled ANA from Tokyo Haneda to Singapore. The flight was operated by the airline’s 787-9. The business cabin was in a 1-2-1 layout with full lie flat seats. The seats were excellent made even more comfortable with the attentive cabin crew and great inflight food. Service and hardware is unbeatable. Keep up the good work ANA!

title: Great hotel near Haneda Airport
text: Stayed overnight at the keiku ex inn during our overnight layover at Haneda Airport. The hotel is a very good alternative to the onsite transit hotel which has sky high rates for a basic room. This hotel is just 10 mins away by complimentary shuttle bus from the international terminal. The hotel and rooms are nice and clean. A very comfortable airport hotel to overnight to catch your next flight in the morning. I surely recommend it. Will stay here again if I have a long overnight transit. Note: this hotel is outside the airport and you need to clear immigration to get to the hotel and vice versa.

title: Nice place for breakfast and coffee
text: Was around the Robertson quay area looking for a quick breakfast and chanced upon this shop. Looked welcoming and prices looked reasonable. Had a ham and cheese omelette and black coffee. Good alternative to breakfast in the hotel buffet if your room don’t come with breakfast.

title: Popular local Ipoh restaurant with nice food
text: Visited the restaurant yesterday for dinner. Food is excellent and the restaurant was very crowded. We enjoyed the food and local atmosphere in the restaurant.

title: Nice hotel in the heart of ipoh
text: Nice hotel in the heart of Ipoh town. The hotel is connected to a mall called Ipoh parade which has lots of shops and even a cinema. Rooms are of good size although carpet and bedding is showing it’s age. WiFi is also a bit patchy as there are some corners the signal can’t reach due to the angle of the room. Suggest the hotel install additional boosters to improve the WiFi signal. Otherwise, a good hotel to stay when in Ipoh.

title: Excellent food and nice ambience
text: We stayed at Weil Hotel and had a family dinner at yuk sou hin. The food was of very good quality and of particular mention is their lychee duck and beef stew. Very yummy! Definitely recommend if you are visiting Ipoh.

title: Amazing Tulip Festival
text: The flower dome garden is currently having a tulip festival. The garden is deck out in many colors of tulips and the display is incredible. It looks as if you are walking through the Dutch tulip fields in the Netherlands! Definitely worth a visit.

title: Nice place for weekend lunch
text: Went to Pollen terrace for lunch. Their ambience and food was nice. Ordered the beef steak. The beef was succulent and tasty! All in all a very nice afternoon at the restaurant.

title: Asia’s Boutique Airline
text: Travelled to Bhutan for a holiday. The only way to fly into Bhutan is either by Druk Air or Bhutan Airlines. I took Druk Air. Both airlines fly the airbus 319. Druk air’s seats and service is impeccable for the 3 hour flight from Bangkok to Paro. Druk Air does not have their own lounge at Bangkok and uses the Air France lounge. All in all, a great airline with equally great service!

title: Luxury in the city
text: Stayed at the Park Hyatt for one night after 2 weeks in Bhutan. The hotel is simply luxurious and wonderful. The rooms are a good size and my room faced the British embassy. Bed and pillows are very comfortable and I had a wonderful sleep. The Hyatt app which supposedly allows you to unlock your room door with your mobile phone was not working during my stay. No explanation or follow up from staff as to why this was so. In the end, I used the conventional card. The hotel is link to a great mall called central Embassy and linked to the Bangkok sky train system.

title: Great Thai food in Thimphu!
text: Was craving for Thai food and chanced upon this restaurant in downtown Thimphu. The Thai dishes are authentic and cooked by the hotel’s Thai chef. The hotel GM Kris and his team was on hand to make the dining experience an enjoyable one. A lovely place to visit if you are looking for authentic Thai food in Thimphu.

title: Great food and excellent service
text: Visited Latest Recipe in Thimphu. Ordered their butter chicken and jeera rice. The chicken was tender and gravy rich and very yummy. The service provided by Samten and Namgay were very attentive and excellent. Service quality was very good. All in all, a wonderful lunch in Thimphu.

title: Good food and great view
text: The restaurant provides a good place to rest and have lunch enroute to either Punakha or Gantey. The food is good and tasty and the staff friendly. To top it off, it comes with a great view of the surrounding rice fields and mountains.

title: Good hotel for Punakha area
text: The Four Boutique is located by the river in Punakha town. It offers decent and modern rooms to rest for travellers using Punakha as a base or heading on to Gasa or Pobjhikha valley. All rooms face the river. Guests with mobility issues may wish to note that the hotel has no lift and will have to walk up the stairs to their rooms which is located on the 3rd and 4th floors of the hotel. The restaurant is located on the 2nd floor. Otherwise, the Four boutique hotel is a good and functional hotel to stay whilst in Punakha.

title: Resort with a nice view
text: This resort sits on a hill and comes with a commanding view of Punakha Dzong. Rooms are average and toilets are old and dirty. Otherwise the view of the Dzong and the surrounding mountains make up for it.

title: Decent place to rest and grab a drink
text: The cafe has nice views of the surrounding mountains. Food is ok and is a popular rest stop for visitors enroute from Thimphu to Punakha or vice versa.

title: Nice place with great ambiance
text: Cloud 9 is a new western based restaurant in Thimphu. Located opposite the stadium, it is the place to go if you are craving for a decent burger and coffee. The decor is modern and apparently popular with both locals and tourists alike.

title: Hotel in need of maintenance
text: Stayed at Namgay Heritage Hotel. Nice hotel at the centre of Thimphu, just above the Meridien. Hotel is in typical Bhutanese architecture style. Rooms are basic but shower is broken. The hotel is showing it’s age and is in need of an urgent refurbishment. Hotel WiFi system is patchy and frustratingly hard to connect. It also needs an urgent overhaul to the WiFi system.

title: The beef is heavenly!
text: We went to fat cow for dinner and had their beef set. Their selection of beef is very good, although not cheap. We had the Miyazaki and was not disappointed. We ended the evening with a smooth junmai daijingo. All in all a very good meal and a very memorable evening.

title: Great place and great food!
text: Dined at Boatwerks during my recent visit to Holland Michigan. It is a must visit place for me when I am in town. The food and ambience is excellent and just beautiful. I had a salmon dish and it was done beautifully. Not too dry and with just enough tenderness. I strongly recommend Boatwerks for a special meal with that special someone or just to enjoy a great evening with good food when one is visiting Holland!

title: Awful flight to Grand Rapids
text: Flew United from Newark to Grand Rapids and I was ushered back in time to their emb 145 aircraft. It was a step back in time and it was not one bit quaint. The aircraft had seen better days and at least 30 years old or older. Seats and interior were old and the armrest on seat 2A was crack causing it to scratch my arm. It was as if I was flying in a third world country! Simply forgettable. I would not recommend flying on their emb 145 aircrafts.

title: Resort Fees
text: Stayed at this property right in the heart of Times Square. Location is convenient and rooms are good size. One bugbear for this hotel is they charge a resort fee irregardless if you use or need the list of perks they offer. I was rudely shocked when I was told about these fees! This fee was not told to me either at time of booking or at time of check in. They should seriously consider removing this fee and aim to provide these perks as standard.
place: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York

title: Great place to enjoy Korean beef
text: After a hard day’s of skiing, this is a nice restaurant to enjoy some great Korean beef. You go to the mart, next door and choose your meat selection and bring it over to the restaurant. The restaurant charge you 4000 won per person to bring you the side dishes. A comfortable and affordable place to go and enjoy the Korean beef after a hard day of skiing!

title: Singapore Airlines A330-300
text:
Flew on Singapore Airlines A330
Business Class from Singapore to Taipei. The SQ product was good but not the latest. In an age when most competitors fly a 1-2-1 configuration for their business class, the SQ A330 product is starting to show. A fellow star alliance carrier flying the same route is offering a superior product. About time to deploy their 787 Dreamliners for this route!

title: Awesome place and food!
text: Visited the above restaurant and boy was it great! The restaurant specialises in seafood but other types of food is available. They have a good selection of wine and sake as well. A must to visit if you are visiting Taipei.

title: Awesome service for short flight
text: I flew business class on Asiana’s A380 from Tokyo Narita to Seoul Incheon Airport. Business class was lie flat seats in 1-2-1 configuration. Service was warm and friendly and food served was of a very good quality. As it was a short flight, I did not get a chance to enjoy the seat in its lie flat mode but am sure it will be very comfortable for a long haul flight!

title: Yummy Kalbitang!
text: This restaurant serves a very delicious beef rib soup. Their Wang kalbitang is super yummy and the restaurant is conveniently located at a serviced apartment in Insa-dong. Worth a trip to try their soup!

title: Nice hotel at ski resort
text: Nice hotel at alpensia ski resort in Pyeongchang. Rooms are pretty standard. Hotel is a short walk to the slopes and hotel guest have a 30% discount for ski pass and equipment rental. Breakfast is so so. Saving grace is the view from the room with a view of the slopes.

title: Impressive Tokyo Hotel
text: Stayed at the Andaz Toranomon in Tokyo. It is a great hotel with amazing rooms which is fairly large for Tokyo hotels. As the rooms start from level 47 to 50, all room comes with sweeping views of Tokyo. The complimentary drinks in the evening is a nice touch. Swimming pool is also awesome.

title: Great hotel in the heart of Bangkok!
text: The Grand Hyatt is an excellent gem of a hotel with a great location close to shopping centres and the BTS. Staff are attentive and helpful. Rooms are in good condition. What else can you ask for? I would stay here again!

title: Chilli Crab Pasta
text: Took my family for dinner at Nassim Hill. Cosy ambience. Menu is western but the chilli crab pasta caught my eye. Ordered and tried it and loved it! The chilli crab pasta is worth trying. Yummy. Nelson from the restaurant made sure everyone was well taken care off. Lovely place to take the family for a weekend meal.
